comment: Take this class if you want an easy A. Don't take this class if you want to learn about biological anthropology. She gives lecture videos online but she just reads the PP. She's young and really doesn't seem to have much practical knowledge of the subject. She also added a lecture about white privilege that isn't even in the textbook. #woke

this teacher was 3/5. posted the assignments at random times of the day. She would post 1 of the many lectures of the week on Monday afternoon, the next the next day. she is easy to reach/nice about grades. class was okay. hard part was the mandatory 300 word discussion posts weekly. 300 words was too much for the topics she wanted us to explain.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: She is literally the best teacher ever. No papers, no lockdown browser. She really wants all her students to succeed and she really does care. If you are looking for a good ANTH teacher PLEASE TAKE HER!!! she is literally the best.
I absolutely loved her as a professor. Weekly quizzes given, pretty easy, no lock down browser or webcam. I just didn't like anthropology.

She will go through the powerpoints at the speed of light, but she uploads them and you can take your notes at your own pace. Quizzes are easy and you can retake your wrong answers and she has open note tests. She is incredibly nice and she really does love anthropology. Good class even if you arent an anthro major.
Truly cares about your education and is willing to support you through your academic journey.

She's an excellent instructor who rewards effort and a willingness to learn. Tests and quizzes are untimed, you can take them twice, and you have the chance to go back for a second attempt if needed. You can't go wrong with her. If you're not choosing her for Anth, I don't know what you're doing!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational
